greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k), n>=1, 0<=k<=n^2, read by rows: row n gives the coefficients of the chromatic polynomial of the square grid graph G_(n,n), highest powers first.
comment: The square grid graph G_(n,n) has n^2 = A000290(n) vertices and 2*n*(n-1) = A046092(n-1) edges. The chromatic polynomial of G_(n,n) has n^2+1 = A002522(n) coefficients.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..9, flattened
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Chromatic Polynomial
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Grid Graph
example: The square grid graph G_(2,2) is the cycle graph C_4 with chromatic polynomial q^4 -4*q^3 +6*q^2 -3*q => row 2 = [1, -4, 6, -3, 0].
mathematica: Reverse /@ CoefficientList[Table[ChromaticPolynomial[GridGraph[{n, n}], x], {n, 5}], x] // Flatten (* _Eric W. Weisstein_, May 01 2017 *)
xref: Sums of absolute values of row elements give: A080690(n).
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 26 2012
